plugins.name: FLOWS (alpha)
plugins.description:
FLOWS is an intelligent Figma plugin that brings senior-level UX design critique directly into your workflow. Powered by AI agents from 1000xDesign, we analyze your user interface designs and provide actionable insights to improve user experience, user flow optimization, and design quality.


Key Features

  1. AI-Powered Analysis - Get instant, professional UX critiques from our intelligent design agents
  2. Flow Context Understanding - Automatically extracts and analyzes user context, goals, and flow patterns
  3. Visual Critique Overlay - Generates design critiques directly on your Figma frames
  4. Real-time Feedback - Receive immediate insights without leaving your design environment
  5. Iterative Improvement - Continuous analysis to refine and optimize your design flows


Request Invite code

reach out to alpha_launch@1000x.design
plugins.tagline: Transform your Figma designs with AI-powered UX critique and flow analysis

plugins.name: Feature-Labeler
plugins.description:
Create numbered badges and description frames for your wireframes with ease. Streamline your design documentation process by adding sequential numbered references to features and their explanations. Convenient for product specifications, user flow documentation, and design handoffs.


  1. Create a Number Badge
  2. Select the badge size (small, medium, or large)
  3. Choose a color from preset options or use the color picker
  4. Click "Create" to add a numbered badge to your design
  5. Create a Description Frame
  6. Select the frame size (small, medium, or large)
  7. Click "Create" to add a description frame with a matching number
  8. Edit Badges and Descriptions
  9. Click on any badge or description frame to edit
  10. Change numbers to reorder the sequence automatically
  11. For badges, you can also update the color
  12. Organize Documentation
  13. Place badges next to UI elements you want to reference
  14. Add explanatory text in the description frames
  15. Badges and descriptions with the same number are linked in the sequence

plugins.name: iconSync
plugins.description:
Simplify your design-to-development workflow by seamlessly integrating Figma with GitHub, ensuring Figma remains your single source of truth.


You can find the implementation in Github


1. Introduction

`icon-sync` is a powerful tool designed to bridge the gap between design and development.

It enables effortless synchronization of icon assets from Figma directly into a GitHub repository.

With minimal setup and a highly intuitive workflow, `icon-sync` ensures that design assets remain version-controlled, up-to-date, and accessible to the entire product team.


2. Why icon-sync?

Managing design assetsâ€”especially iconsâ€”can become chaotic across growing teams and projects.

Designers work in Figma, while developers often rely on versioned assets stored in GitHub. This disconnect can lead to:


Outdated assets being used in production.

Manual, error-prone handoffs.

Lack of traceability in design changes.


`icon-sync` solves these issues by automating the synchronization of icons from Figma to GitHub, removing the need for repetitive manual exports and uploads.

It aligns the design and engineering workflows and helps establish Figma as the canonical source for icon assets.


3. Features

ğŸ¯ One-Click GitHub Integration

Push your icons from Figma to GitHub in a single action. No more file downloads or commit commands.


ğŸ§  Smart Change Detection

Only changed or new icons are processed, ensuring minimal diffs and cleaner version history.


ğŸ” Automated Pull Request Generation

Every sync automatically generates a pull request containing updated icons and metadata, complete with commit messages and diffs.


4. Installation & Configuration

âš™ï¸ Prerequisites:

Install `icon-sync` Figma plugin

A GitHub access token


Step 1: Install the Plugin

Install the `icon-sync` Figma plugin from the Figma community.


Step 2: GitHub Access Token Setup


To use `icon-sync`, you must provide a GitHub Access Token. There are two options depending on your preference and security requirements:


Option 1: Personal Access Token (Classic)

If you're using a Personal Access Token, make sure to grant the repo.


âš ï¸ This approach is simple but grants broad access to your repositories. Use with caution if you have sensitive data or multiple repositories under the same account.


Option 2: Fine-Grained Personal Access Token (Recommended)

If you're using a Fine-Grained Access Token, you'll need to specify individual repository permissions, Make sure to select the following:


Contents â†’ `Read and write`

Allows access to files and blobs in the repository, which is required for uploading icons.


Metadata â†’ `Read-only`

Allows the plugin to retrieve basic repository information.


Pull Requests â†’ `Read and write`

Enables the plugin to automatically create and update pull requests.


5. Usage

Once installed and configured, using `icon-sync` is straightforward.


Step 1: Environment Setup

After launching the `icon-sync` plugin, navigate to the **GitHub** tab.


Youâ€™ll see several input fields you need to fill out:

Owner â€“ your GitHub username or organization name

API Key â€“ your GitHub access token

Main Branch Name â€“ usually `main` or `master`

Compare Branch Name â€“ a branch to create for the pull request (e.g., `icon/update`)

Repository Name â€“ the target GitHub repository

Store Path â€“ the directory in the repo where icons should be stored (e.g., `icons/`)


Once you complete these fields, youâ€™re ready to import icons.


Note: These settings are saved locally after the first setup, so you wonâ€™t need to re-enter them every time you open the plugin.


Step 2: Import Icons from Figma

You have **two options** to import icons from your Figma file:


Option 1: Auto-Import from Current Page

As soon as the plugin launches, it will automatically scan the **current Figma page** and import all icons that are structured as components.


Option 2: Frame-Based Import

Alternatively, you can:


1. Create a Frame in your Figma file.

2. Select the Frame.

3. Click the "Import Icons" button in the plugin.


This will import only the icons within the selected Frame.


Step 3: Deploy to GitHub

Once you've finished both steps above, you're ready to deploy your icons to GitHub.


Click the Deploy button to start the upload process.

`icon-sync` will automatically commit the icons and open a pull request in your repository.

After deployment, a "Go to GitHub" button will appear. Click it to jump directly to the pull request and review the changes.
plugins.tagline: Sync icons from Figma to GitHub

plugins.name: Text Style Usage Analyzer
plugins.description: Analyze and visualize the usage of text styles in your Figma project. This plugin lists all text styles (even unused ones), sorts them by usage, and displays a bar chart next to each style. Green bars indicate high usage, yellow for medium, and red for zero usage. Perfect for cleaning up unused styles and optimizing your design system.

plugins.name: Text Style Mapping
plugins.description:
Text Style Mapping simplifies the process of applying text styles to multiple text layers in your Figma designs.


Features:

  1. Apply text styles to both styled and unstyled text layers at once
  2. Automatically groups similar unstyled text based on font family, weight, size, and line height
  3. Switch between styled and unstyled text with an easy tab interface
  4. Works with your existing text styles library


How to use:

  1. Select a frame containing text elements
  2. Choose text styles from the dropdown menus
  3. Click "Apply Styles" to update all selected text layers at once


Note: This plugin may have limitations when working with text styles that use design tokens or local variables due to Figma API constraints.


This plugin helps maintain design consistency by making text styling quick and efficient across your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Layer Formatter
plugins.description:
Streamline your design-to-development workflow with Layer Formatter, a powerful tool that simplifies layer renaming. Whether you need hyphens, underscores, camel case, or kebab case, this tool ensures your layers align perfectly with coding conventions.


Say goodbye to messy names and hello to clean, developer-friendly files. Perfect for effortless handoff and collaboration!


âœ¨ Key Features âœ¨


  1. Auto-Space Conversion: Automatically replace spaces in layer names with underscores (_) or remove them entirely for clean, code-friendly naming.
  2. Batch Rename Layers: Rename multiple layers in seconds, saving time and improving efficiency.
  3. Flexible Naming Styles: Supports hyphens, underscores, camel case, kebab case, and more to fit your coding standards.
  4. Instant Updates: Apply changes with a single clickâ€”no need for tedious manual edits.
  5. Streamlined Handoff: Deliver developer-ready files with consistent, clean layer names for seamless collaboration.

plugins.name: Sierotki Eliminator
plugins.description:
Sierotki Eliminator tackles a common issue in Polish typography known as "sierotki" (literally "orphans"). In Polish texts, single-letter words like "a", "i", "o", "u", "w", or "z" at the end of a line are considered typographic errors.


This plugin automatically replaces the space after these single-letter words with a non-breaking space, ensuring they always stay with the following word. By eliminating "sierotki", it enhances the visual appeal and readability of your Polish text in Figma designs.


Whether you're a Polish designer or working on Polish-language projects, Sierotki Eliminator helps you maintain proper typography.
plugins.tagline: Remove single-letter words at the end of a line

plugins.name: Find and Replace Screens
plugins.description:
Find and Replace Screens is a tool designed to streamline the process of updating screens in Figma with just one click. Whether you're transitioning from wireframes to final UI designs or updating screens across an entire flow, this plugin saves you time by keeping your layout, connectors, and arrows intact. No more manual re-positioning or reconnecting screens!


Key features:

  1. One-Click screen replacement: Update multiple instances of the same screen with a single action, ideal for projects where the same screen is used in multiple places.
  2. Preserves layout and flow: Replacing a screen won't disturb its surrounding elements, including arrows, connectors, and positions within the flow.
  3. Flexible use case: While perfect for wireframe-to-UI transitions, the plugin is also useful for updating iterations of any design screen without losing structure.


How to Use:

  1. Choose the new screen you want to use (UI design, updated iteration, etc.).
  2. Select the screen(s) you want to replace in the flow.
  3. Click "Replace Screen" to swap the content while maintaining connections and layout positions.


Limitations:

  1. For best results, ensure the new screens are similar in size to the ones being replaced, as large size differences may affect layout alignment.
  2. Does not adjust connectors/arrows if the new screen's size significantly differs from the original.
plugins.tagline: Find and Replace Screens across your project with one click while keeping connections intact.

plugins.name: Variable Calculator
plugins.description:
Easily calculate variable values

Use Variable Calculator to apply math formulas, recalculating your variables. Apply to en entire collection, specific group, or specific mode. Great for scaling numbers for responsive behavior.


  1. Select your collection
  2. Select the target mode or all modes
  3. Enter the path to a group of variables
  4. Enter the formula to apply to the variables
  5. Calculate!


Tip

  1. Use a, b, c, n, v, x, $ or value to reference the current variable value.
  2. Keep your variable window open to see the changes.
  3. Use the Refresh button to pull in changes to the variables made when the plugin window is open. (see below for copy & paste)
  4. Use clear to quickly delete the path.


Plugin Notes

  1. Variable names and paths are case sensitive.
  2. Updating variables, especially those linked to text styles may take longer to propagate.


Copy/Paste Figma Bug

If you copy/paste variables between collections, you may need to reload the tab in order for those variables to register in their new collection.

plugins.name: Chroma Forge
plugins.description:
Chroma Forge for Figma


A powerful color selection plugin for Figma that provides an intuitive color wheel and advanced color harmony tools to create consistent color palettes.


Features


Interactive Color Wheel

  1. High-precision color selection with a fully interactive color wheel
  2. Adjustable brightness and saturation sliders
  3. Real-time color preview
  4. HEX code input with validation


Color Harmony Tools

  1. Create cohesive color palettes using different harmony types:
  2. Analogous: Colors that are adjacent to each other on the color wheel
  3. Triad: Three colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
  4. Complementary: Colors opposite each other on the color wheel
  5. Split Complementary: A main color and two colors adjacent to its complement
  6. Square: Four colors evenly spaced around the color wheel
  7. Compound: A combination of complementary and analogous harmonies
  8. Mono: A single color with various shades
  9. Custom: Create your own custom harmony by placing markers freely


Flexible Color Selection

  1. Select 2-6 colors at once (depending on harmony type)
  2. Drag markers on the wheel to fine-tune your color selection
  3. Automatic contrast adjustment for optimal visibility


Figma Integration

  1. Apply selected colors directly to selected elements
  2. Create color styles from your palette
  3. Generate color variables with automatic shade variants (10% to 100% brightness)
  4. Intelligent naming system for organizing colors


How to Use


Select a Harmony Type: Choose from the dropdown menu to define how colors relate to each other

Select Number of Colors: Choose how many colors you want in your palette (2-6)

Choose Your Base Color: Click and drag on the color wheel or enter a HEX code

Adjust Saturation and Brightness: Use the sliders to fine-tune your colors

Apply Colors: Use the buttons to:

  1. Apply directly to selected elements
  2. Add to Figma color styles
  3. Add to Figma variables (with automatic shade creation)

plugins.name: State Machines
plugins.description:
Create state machines and integrate them directly into your designs.


What is a state machine?


Think of a state machine as a way to organize all the different "states" your design can be in. For example, a form might have states like "empty," "filled," "submitting," or "error." State machines help you clearly define these states and the rules for moving between them, making complex interactions more manageable.


---


This plugin is experimental. Contributions and feature requests welcome: github.com/colebemis/figma-state-machines

---


This Figma plugin, "Find Components," helps you efficiently select main components or instances from multiple selected layers.


Key features:

  1. Component/Instance filtering: You can extract and select only main components or instances from the selected layers.
  2. Selection target switching: You can choose whether to target main components or instances from the dropdown menu.
  3. Support for grouped layers: You can find and select components or instances nested deep within grouped layers.
  4. Process cancellation: You can cancel the process midway if the execution process is heavy.


This plugin is useful in the following situations:

  1. Organizing design systems: When you want to efficiently find specific components or instances from a large number of them.
  2. Updating designs: When you want to link multiple instances to the main component at once.
  3. Collaboration: When you want to efficiently understand the components and instances created by team members.

plugins.description:
1. Text Font Size Adaptation for Different Image Dimension Requirements

Automatically adjusts text font size by modifying the fixed width and line count parameters according to different image dimension needs (e.g., designs for multiple e-commerce platforms), enabling rapid completion of typesetting in such scenarios.


2. Text Font Size Adaptation for Different Language Requirements

Through configuring font family, font weight, and line height settings, the plugin automatically adjusts font sizes for text content in various languages to adapt to the preset text width and line count, thereby quickly fulfilling typesetting requirements for globalized designs.


Features:


âŒ¨ï¸ Methods to Obtain Text:

Designers can acquire text content requiring adaptive font sizes either by selecting text nodes or inputting/pasting new text in the plugin's input field.


ğŸ”„ Reacquire Text Content & Text Properties:

Designers can click the refresh button to reacquire the text content, font, font weight, and line height of selected text layers on the canvas for further adjustments and optimization.


ğŸ‘€ Predict Actual Line Count:

The plugin features actual line count prediction capability, forecasting real line numbers based on current text content and settings to help designers better plan text layout.


â†™ï¸ Window Scaling:

The plugin window can be minimized by collapsing setting items, proving highly efficient in scenarios requiring rapid multi-language text replacement using identical text properties.

Switch between light/dark themes

Instant Chinese/English interface language switching

132040.name: AdaptaFontâ€”Intelligent Font Scaling for Seamless Multi-Format Scenarios
132040.description:
1. Text Font Size Adaptation for Different Image Dimension Requirements

Automatically adjusts text font size by modifying the fixed width and line count parameters according to different image dimension needs (e.g., designs for multiple e-commerce platforms), enabling rapid completion of typesetting in such scenarios.


2. Text Font Size Adaptation for Different Language Requirements

Through configuring font family, font weight, and line height settings, the plugin automatically adjusts font sizes for text content in various languages to adapt to the preset text width and line count, thereby quickly fulfilling typesetting requirements for globalized designs.


Features:


âŒ¨ï¸ Methods to Obtain Text:

Designers can acquire text content requiring adaptive font sizes either by selecting text nodes or inputting/pasting new text in the plugin's input field.


ğŸ”„ Reacquire Text Content & Text Properties:

Designers can click the refresh button to reacquire the text content, font, font weight, and line height of selected text layers on the canvas for further adjustments and optimization.


ğŸ‘€ Predict Actual Line Count:

The plugin features actual line count prediction capability, forecasting real line numbers based on current text content and settings to help designers better plan text layout.


â†™ï¸ Window Scaling:

The plugin window can be minimized by collapsing setting items, proving highly efficient in scenarios requiring rapid multi-language text replacement using identical text properties.


ğŸ¨ Theme Switching & Language Toggling

Switch between light/dark themes

Instant Chinese/English interface language switching

plugins.name: HubSpot Developers: UI Extensions Auto Card Builder
plugins.description:
Welcome to the HubSpot Developers Figma Plugin for our UI Extensions Figma Design Kit

This plugin is brought to you by HubSpot DevRel Labs, an initiative to create solutions for developers to thrive while building with HubSpot.


Requirements: HubSpot UI Extensions Figma Design Kit


Create amazing HubSpot UI Extensions designs in minutes. Do you need to prototype a UI Extension quickly for your clients? Well, now you can with the HubSpot UI Extensions Figma plugin. Download the Figma Design Kit, install this plugin and choose from our library of UI components. Add multiple of the same components to a card, order them in any way you'd like, and watch the magic happen as the UI extension is built for you.


Upcoming Features

  1. Add pre-defined use-cases to choose from that will auto-populate the card with the appropriate components.
  2. Add a way to auto-generate the UI Extension code from the components you choose.


Please leave any and all feedback for this plugin on our Feedback form. Please specify that you're sharing feedback for our Figma UI Extension Builder plugin.

---------------

Made with ğŸ§¡ by the HubSpot DevRel Team.

Learn more about UI Extensions on our developer documentation site.

HubSpot UI Extensions are currently in beta and subject to the Early Adopter Program terms. Read the terms.

plugins.name: TRANS-AI
plugins.description:
TRANS-AI helps designers create multilingual designs by translating text layers and automatically adjusting layouts for right-to-left languages.


Key Features:

  1. Translate selected text layers using OpenAI, Anthropic, or Gemini API (bring your own API key)
  2. One-click layout conversion between RTL and LTR designs
  3. Option to automatically adjust layouts when translating to/from RTL languages
  4. Exclude specific layers from translation using the layer name filter
  5. Preserves text formatting while converting layouts


Perfect for teams creating multilingual products, localizing interfaces, or working with global audiences. TRANS-AI streamlines the localization workflow, saving designers hours of manual adjustments when adapting designs for different languages.
plugins.tagline: Go global in seconds! AI-powered translation with smart RTL/LTR layout conversion.

plugins.name: Notion Book Cover Formatter
plugins.description:
Notion Book Cover Formatter solves the common problem of adapting vertical book covers (typically in 2:3 ratio) to Notion's responsive format. Instead of struggling with manual resizing and background creation, this plugin automatically:

  1. Positions your book cover perfectly within the Notion image dimensions
  2. Creates a beautiful and consistent background from the original cover


Step by step instructions:

  1. Upload a book cover image
  2. Plugin creates a frame containing the formatted image
  3. Export the frame
  4. Upload to Notion as "Files & Media"
plugins.tagline: Notion-ready book covers with a single image upload

plugins.name: Console CLI
plugins.description:
Console CLI lets you control Figma using commands. You can list fonts, styles, and components, create shapes, get details about selected elements, check file analytics, and view user info.


Commands:

  1. help : See available commands
  2. ls : Lists data related to fonts, styles, or components
  3. ls fonts : List all fonts used in the file
  4. ls styles : List all styles used in file file
  5. ls components : List all components in the file
  6. shape : Create a new shapes based on the specified type
  7. shape rect <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create rectangle
  8. shape circle <diameter> [x] [y] : Create circle
  9. shape ellipse <width> <height> [x] [y] : Create ellipse
  10. shape polygon <sides> <radius> [x] [y] : Create polygon
  11. shape star <points> <outer-radius> <inner-radius> [x] [y] : Create star
  12. selection : Info about the currently selected nodes
  13. selection --verbose : Additional details about the selection
  14. analytics : Retrieve file analytics
  15. whoami : Retrieves info about the current user
  16. clear : Clear the console
  17. exit : Close the plugin
plugins.tagline: CLI for Figma. List elements, create shapes, get selection info, and check file analytics.

plugins.name: Your AI Co-Pilot
plugins.description:
Your AI Co-Pilot provides instant design feedback directly within Figma. Select any design elements to receive AI-powered analysis across four key areas:


â€¢ UI Design: Visual hierarchy, color usage, spacing, and consistency

â€¢ Content: Readability, clarity, and copy suggestions

â€¢ User Experience: Usability issues and interaction patterns

â€¢ Accessibility: WCAG compliance recommendations


The plugin analyzes selected frames, components, or groups and generates actionable feedback to improve your designs. You can ask follow-up questions to get more detailed explanations or recommendations.


All analysis is performed securely through our backend API using advanced AI models. No design data is stored permanently - it's only processed temporarily during analysis.
plugins.tagline: Instant AI feedback on your designs

plugins.name: Copy SVG to Webflow
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you copy an SVG from Figma and paste it directly into your Webflow page.


Options:

  1. Use currentColor for fills
  2. Use currentColor for strokes
  3. Pass custom classes to Webflow (in 'class' attribute)
  4. Set Width and Height to 100%
  5. Set preserveAspectRatio


Enjoy!
plugins.tagline: Copy SVGs from Figma to Webflow with Classes

plugins.name: Text Paster
plugins.description:
What it does

This plugin allows you to:

  1. Select text layers from a selection
  2. Copy text strings from multiple text layers
  3. Paste text strings into multiple text layers in batch
  4. Sort text strings


How to use it

Transfer texts between frame

  1. Select a frame that contain text layers
  2. Click Copy in the plugin
  3. Select another frame that contain text layers you want to transfer the texts to
  4. Click Paste in the plugin


Transfer text from Spreadsheet

  1. Copy text from a spreadsheet (Google Sheets, Excel, etc.) or any line-break-separated text.
  2. Paste it into the text box in plugin
  3. Select a frame that contain text layers you want to paste the texts to
  4. Click Paste in the plugin


Delete hidden layers

  1. Select a frame
  2. Click Select "Hidden layer" (from dropdown menu)
  3. Press Delete key to delete hidden layers


-------

Kudos to AI â€” This plugin is the result of vibe coding with Cursor and GitHub Copilot. All the features were built just to scratch my own itches.
plugins.tagline: Trasfer text in batch with copy and paste

plugins.name: AI Real Data Generator
plugins.description:
Description

Testing with real-life data is crucial, but setting up prototypes manually is time-consuming. With AI Real Data Generator Figma plugin, simply provide AI with your instructions and an exampleâ€”using your Gemini API key, it will instantly generate and replace data in your design, making prototyping seamless and efficient.


How to Use:

  1. Add the AI Real Data Generator plugin in Figma.
  2. Enter your Gemini API key to enable data generation.
  3. Provide instructions on the type of real-life data you need.
  4. Provide an example or data template to guide AI generation.
  5. AI instantly generates and replaces data directly in your Figma design.


Key Features:


  1. Instant data generation: AI quickly fills in real-world data in seconds.
  2. Customizable: Provide specific instructions and examples to match your needs.
  3. Seamless integration: Data replaces existing placeholders in your design automatically.
  4. Efficiency boost: Save time on manual data entry during prototyping.
  5. Powered by Gemini API: Leverage advanced AI for precise data generation, enabled with the free gemini-2.0-flash modal
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma designs with real-world data using AI-powered precision

plugins.name: Convert To Bionic Writing
plugins.description:
Unlock Faster, More Focused Reading with Bionic Reading: This plugin applies the Bionic Reading method (bionic-reading.com) to your text layers, dynamically bolding the initial letters of words to improve reading speed and comprehension. By leveraging the natural fixation points of the eye, Bionic Reading helps readers process text more efficiently with less cognitive effort. This plugin works best with fonts that offer multiple weight variations.


Key Features:


  1. Converts selected text layers to Bionic Reading format.
  2. Optimizes text for faster and more focused reading.
  3. Ideal for improving readability and engagement.



Open Source: github.com/mrayubmuhammad/Convert-To-Bionic-Writing-Figma-Plugin



Created by d3flow (www.d3flow.com) using Claude.ai.

Note: Requires fonts with multiple weight options for optimal performance.
